about.title: About me
about.description: I am Marina Ilyushina, a lawyer in Athens, and I provide comprehensive legal services to individuals and businesses throughout Greece as well as to foreign clients. I am a graduate of the National and Kapodistrian University of Athens and a member of the Piraeus Bar Association. I methodically manage each case, from initial assessment to final outcome, with the goal of prompt and fair resolution, in full compliance with Greek law.

workMethod.title: How I work
workMethod.description: I combine strategic guidance, cost transparency and dynamic representation at every stage. I collaborate with an organized team of more than 10 experienced lawyers, to provide comprehensive, specialized solutions even in complex cases.
workMethod.cta: Need reliable legal support? Contact for initial assessment and targeted action proposal.

family.title: Family & Inheritance Law
family.description: Specialized services in family law in Athens

content.description: I have years of experience in family law cases and inheritance disputes. I handle family matters such as divorces, child custody regulation and alimony, with priority to protecting your family's interests. In parallel, I deal with inheritance matters – from drafting and checking wills to managing inheritance and transferring property. With sensitivity and human-centered approach, I provide reliable advice and representation to protect your rights in family and inheritance disputes.

introduction.title: 1. Introduction
introduction.content: This Privacy Policy explains how lawyer Marina Ilyushina, as the Data Controller, collects, uses, and protects personal data obtained through the Website. The processing of personal data is governed by the General Data Protection Regulation (EU 2016/679 – GDPR), Law 4624/2019, and Law 3471/2006. The lawyer is committed to respecting the privacy of visitors and protecting their personal data.

dataCollection.title: 2. What data we collect
dataCollection.content: Providing personal data is not required for simple browsing of the Website. However, we collect data in the following cases:
list: Contact data: When you send us an email or fill out a contact form, we collect your name, surname, email address, phone number, and message content to respond to your request.

Technical data: When visiting the Website, we may collect anonymous information such as IP address, browser type and version, operating system, visit time, and pages viewed, through cookies and other technologies. For more information, see our Cookie Policy.
dataCollection.note: We do not require or collect sensitive data (e.g., health data) through the Website.

dataCollectionMethods.title: 3. How we collect data
dataCollectionMethods.content: Personal data is provided directly by you when:
list: you contact us by email, phone, or contact forms,
you subscribe to newsletters or request informational materials,
you provide us with information for the provision of legal services.
dataCollectionMethods.additional: We may also collect anonymous information through cookies to improve website functionality and analyze traffic.

legalBasis.title: 4. Legal basis for processing
legalBasis.content: Processing is carried out only when there is a legal basis, such as:
list: Contract performance or pre-contractual relations: Processing is necessary for the provision of legal services or responding to your request.
Legitimate interest: We process data to communicate with you and respond to messages or requests (e.g., responding to emails), as there is a legitimate interest.
Consent: When your consent is requested for specific purposes (e.g., sending newsletters). You can withdraw your consent at any time.
Legal obligations: Processing may be necessary to comply with legal obligations (e.g., maintaining tax records).

dataUsage.title: 5. Use of data
dataUsage.content: We use your personal data to:
list: communicate with you and respond to requests or questions,
provide legal services that you request,
manage the website and improve user experience,
prevent and detect malicious activities or fraud.
dataUsage.note: We do not use your data for commercial promotion purposes without your explicit consent.

dataSharing.title: 6. Sharing with third parties
dataSharing.content: We do not sell or share your personal data with third parties for commercial purposes. Access to data may be granted to trusted external partners (e.g., hosting providers, IT companies) exclusively to the extent necessary for the provision of their services, and provided that they commit to appropriate security measures.
dataSharing.additional: Data may be disclosed to government authorities or judicial bodies when required by law. We do not transfer data outside the European Economic Area (EEA) without complying with legal safeguards.

rights.title: 7. Data subject rights
rights.content: As a data subject, you have the following rights under GDPR and Law 4624/2019:
list: Right of access: request confirmation that we process your data and obtain a copy.
Right of rectification or erasure: request correction of inaccurate data or their deletion when they are no longer necessary.
Right to restriction or objection to processing: request restriction or object to processing in certain cases.
Right to data portability: obtain your data in a structured, commonly used, and machine-readable format and transfer it to another controller.
Right to withdraw consent: withdraw your consent at any time without prejudice to the lawfulness of processing based on it before withdrawal.
Right to lodge a complaint: lodge a complaint with the Hellenic Data Protection Authority (Λεωφόρος Κηφισίας 1-3, Τ.Κ. 115 23 Αθήνα, www.dpa.gr) if you believe your rights are being violated.
rights.contact: To exercise your rights, you can contact us in writing at ilyushina.law@gmail.com. The lawyer reserves the right to request sufficient information for your identification before satisfying the request.

security.title: 8. Data security
security.content: We have implemented appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect personal data against accidental or unlawful destruction, loss, alteration, unauthorized access, or disclosure. Despite these efforts, no method of data transmission or storage over the internet is absolutely secure, and therefore we cannot guarantee complete security.
security.additional: Access to personal data is limited to authorized persons who commit to confidentiality and use the data exclusively for the purposes for which it was collected.

retention.title: 9. Data retention
retention.content: We retain your personal data only for the time necessary to fulfill the purposes for which it was collected, or as required by legislation. We delete it when:
list: the purpose for which it was collected no longer exists,
you withdraw your consent, if processing was based on consent,
the legal retention period has expired.

cookies.title: 10. Cookies
cookies.content: We use cookies to improve website functionality and analyze traffic. For detailed information on how we use cookies, see our Cookie Policy.

changes.title: 11. Changes to the privacy policy
changes.content: We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time. Any changes will be published on this page with the date of the last update. It is recommended to check this page regularly for information about any changes.

contact.title: 12. Contact information
contact.content: For any questions regarding this Privacy Policy or the processing of your personal data, you can contact us:
